pages.title: Grants

content.text: Grants usually fund one-off initiatives perceived as creating value for the community. Examples include product/protocol modules, code reviews, relevant research, bd/growth initiatives, and ecosystem support initiatives. When the grant amount or delivery duration is significant, proposals can include milestones and quantitative metrics on what constitutes successful delivery. When the initiative benefits multiple communities, disclosing other funding applications can serve as a positive social signal.
A 1-paragraph summary of the Grants proposal. It should
describe the fund usage and include
Provide context of the proposal. Describe the current challenges, history, and stakeholders involved.
Provide context for Why and Why Now?
Provide a high-level schedule of implementation. If complexity demands it, provide detailed schedule and execution plans.
Provide the cost of the grants and frequency of deployment

pages.contentText: Grants usually fund one-off initiatives perceived as creating value for the community. Examples include product/protocol modules, code reviews, relevant research, bd/growth initiatives, and ecosystem support initiatives. When the grant amount or delivery duration is significant, proposals can include milestones and quantitative metrics on what constitutes successful delivery. When the initiative benefits multiple communities, disclosing other funding applications can serve as a positive social signal.SUMMARYA 1-paragraph summary of the Grants proposal. It should describe the fund usage and include a high-level budget. MOTIVATIONProvide context of the proposal. Describe the current challenges, history, and stakeholders involved. RATIONALEProvide context for Why and Why Now?IMPLEMENTATIONProvide high-level execution stepsTIMELINEProvide a high-level schedule of implementation. If complexity demands it, provide detailed schedule and execution plans.COSTProvide the cost of the grants and frequency of deployment

pages.title: Budget

content.text: Budgets usually fund continuous workstreams and value-creating initiatives. Examples include product/protocol development, growth, and operations. Workstream funding proposals are typically bound to specific timeframes (e.g., seasons, quarters) and have well-articulated qualitative and quantitative deliverables. Often the teams performing specific workstreams remain consistent across timeframes.
level breakdown of the amount in percentage spend. Represent amounts in DAO tokens and fiat
Provide major milestones expected to achieve based on

pages.contentText: Budgets usually fund continuous workstreams and value-creating initiatives. Examples include product/protocol development, growth, and operations. Workstream funding proposals are typically bound to specific timeframes (e.g., seasons, quarters) and have well-articulated qualitative and quantitative deliverables. Often the teams performing specific workstreams remain consistent across timeframes.SUMMARYHigh-level summary of the requestAMOUNTAmount of the request. A high-level breakdown of the amount in percentage spend. Represent amounts in DAO tokens and fiatMILESTONESProvide major milestones expected to achieve based on the budget requestFUNDS SPENT TO DATEProvide date ranges and amountPROGRESS MADEA 1-paragraph summary of progressMISSES, DIRECTION CHANGES, & LESSONS LEARNEDA 1-paragraph summary of learnings INITIATIVE COMMITMENTSInitiativeObjectivesKey ResultsBUDGET BREAKDOWNProvide A high-level breakdown of the budgetTEAM COMPOSITIONFull TimePart-Time

pages.title: Investments

content.text: A defining hallmark of investment proposals is that the community trades treasury assets for another asset it anticipates to increase in value. Examples can be on-chain (tokens, vesting tokens, NFTs, staked tokens) and off-chain (any traditional world asset). Investments can be purely market-driven or also strategically driven. Strategic decisions can be caused by partner incentive alignment, meta-governance, or M&A.
Amount of the request. A high-level breakdown of the amount in percentage spend. Represent amounts in DAO tokens and fiat
Describe the unmet community or customer needs and their size
Provide the structure of the deal. Include the type and amount of assets being exchanged. Also, pro
vide the methodologies used to value the assets.
Detail description of the funding uses

Depending on the location(s) of the deals, this could be a very long and complicated section. Provide all considerations to ensure that the arrangements are within the legal and compliance frameworks of the local government(s).

pages.contentText: A defining hallmark of investment proposals is that the community trades treasury assets for another asset it anticipates to increase in value. Examples can be on-chain (tokens, vesting tokens, NFTs, staked tokens) and off-chain (any traditional world asset). Investments can be purely market-driven or also strategically driven. Strategic decisions can be caused by partner incentive alignment, meta-governance, or M&A.SUMMARYHigh-level summary of the requestAMOUNTAmount of the request. A high-level breakdown of the amount in percentage spend. Represent amounts in DAO tokens and fiatMARKET OPPORTUNITIESDescribe the unmet community or customer needs and their sizeDEAL DETAILSProvide the structure of the deal. Include the type and amount of assets being exchanged. Also, provide the methodologies used to value the assets. USE OF FUNDSDetail description of the funding usesLEGAL & COMPLIANCEDepending on the location(s) of the deals, this could be a very long and complicated section. Provide all considerations to ensure that the arrangements are within the legal and compliance frameworks of the local government(s).

pages.title: Protocol Changes

content.text: Protocol proposals are used to drive changes in a product controlled by the community, especially on-chain products. These changes can be large or small. For small and low-risk changes, including inflation rate and yield rate adjustments, a lightweight proposal can be used. Additional rigor and communications will be required for high-risk changes such as major product updates. Major changes often are accompanied by audits.
Provide a clear and comprehensive explanation of the change. Include the rationales.
Provide details of the change and implementations
Outline likely risk items and what might go wrong.
Provide the name and info of the auditor, the code that was audited, and the results

pages.contentText: Protocol proposals are used to drive changes in a product controlled by the community, especially on-chain products. These changes can be large or small. For small and low-risk changes, including inflation rate and yield rate adjustments, a lightweight proposal can be used. Additional rigor and communications will be required for high-risk changes such as major product updates. Major changes often are accompanied by audits.SummaryProvide a clear and comprehensive explanation of the change. Include the rationales.SpecificationProvide details of the change and implementationsKnown RiskOutline likely risk items and what might go wrong.AuditsProvide the name and info of the auditor, the code that was audited, and the results

pages.title: Metagov Changes

content.text: Sometimes a community needs to change its governance, e.g., migrating from  Governor Alpha to Governor Bravo. Typically these meta-governance proposals take the form of contract migrations, but they can also involve the creation of subgroup structures. Additionally, they can involve
off-chain governance structures, such as moving governance forums, adopting off-chain voting methods, etc.
Describe the rationales behind the governance structure change proposed. Include reasons for why now.
challenges that are prompting the change
Provide the details of the proposed system. Describe the pros and cons of such a system.
Expand on the steps required for this change.

pages.contentText: Sometimes a community needs to change its governance, e.g., migrating from  Governor Alpha to Governor Bravo. Typically these meta-governance proposals take the form of contract migrations, but they can also involve the creation of subgroup structures. Additionally, they can involve using off-chain governance structures, such as moving governance forums, adopting off-chain voting methods, etc.SummaryProvide a 1-paragraph summary of the change and its rationalesMotivationDescribe the rationales behind the governance structure change proposed. Include reasons for why now.Previous Governance StructureDescribe the current governance structure and the challenges that are prompting the changeProposed ChangesProvide the details of the proposed system. Describe the pros and cons of such a system. Implementation DetailsExpand on the steps required for this change. Next StepsAssuming positive reception, what happens?

pages.title: Delegate Governance

content.text: Delegation is an everyday workflow for governance, as people allocate their voting power to a council, i.e.
or a third-party service. Often these delegates are investors, early contributors, college blockchain clubs, or professional service organizations.
What is the total of owned voting power and delegations
Have you been actively involved in the community
Why should you be a delegate?
What is your experience and track record
What do you want to see happen?
What changes are you pushing for in the project
What are you a Subject Matter Expert for? What are your favorite projects/themes?
Are you an active delegate or investor in competing projects?
Anything else that might help delegates verify themselves as good candidates

pages.contentText: Delegation is an everyday workflow for governance, as people allocate their voting power to a council, i.e., a multisig, a subgroup, or a third-party service. Often these delegates are investors, early contributors, college blockchain clubs, or professional service organizations.Personal InformationName/pseudonym, contact information, address, etc.Current voting powerWhat is the total of owned voting power and delegationsPast ParticipationHave you been actively involved in the communityWhy should you be a delegate?What is your experience and track recordWhat do you want to see happen?What changes are you pushing for in the projectWeb3 InterestsWhat are you a Subject Matter Expert for? What are your favorite projects/themes?Conflicts of interestAre you an active delegate or investor in competing projects?Additional informationAnything else that might help delegates verify themselves as good candidates

children.contentText: You can restrict access to this page and subpages using role-based access control.  1. Create a role for exclusive accessClick Settings in the left side menuClick Roles & Permissions, then Add a role 2. Build an invite link and include roleClick Invite Members in the left side menuClick AddYou can choose to add a Private link or a Token GateAttach exclusive access role to the link you create. Members who join your space through this link will be assigned the attached role.Share invite link with members who should have access to the exclusive content on this page and subpages. 3.
